title: Graph Neural Network (GNN)-based Approach for Wireless Network Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of wireless network fundamentals, machine learning basics, and matrix operations
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training course for technical professionals, integrating real-time coding exercises with case studies.

learning_goals: Learners can explain an integer user assignment optimization model utilizing the Gumbel-Softmax technique.
Learners can implement a joint optimization process for beamforming vectors and user associations using a GNN (Graph Neural Network) structure.
Learners can quantitatively analyze the performance comparison of the proposed optimization technique and its scalability advantages in large-scale networks.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
